channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2025030019
item.description:
Report E-2025030019

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-01
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, they observed an estimated (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 330-gallon plastic tote that was cracked at the top of the tote from improper preparation for shipping. SET Environmental personnel observed that the released material impacted 3 ft-by-2 ft of trailer and concrete dock floor. SET Environmental personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized them along with the cut-up tote and PPE into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining material in the product tote was to be transferred to two (2) 275-gallon IBC tote. Generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030016
item.description:
Report E-2025030016

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 25, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon can of paint was damaged and released approximately 1-gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020362
item.description:
Report E-2025020362

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-28T00:58:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-12
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one fourth (.25) of a cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being damaged. The five-gallon metal pail and plastic wrap that was around the original product was containerized it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025021105
item.description:
Report X-2025021105

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTICED FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT LEAKING IN A LINE FORM FROM TOP CORNER TO BOTTOM CORNER. AUDITOR NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND SUPERVISOR NOTIFED RMP TO SEND A RESPONDER TO THE AUDITOR FLOOR AREA. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET SINCE HAZMAT HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL ON IT. RESPONDER READ FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND USED ZEP ZORBENT TO CONTAINERIZE THE FLAMMABLE LQUID HAZMAT INTO A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER CLEANED UP REMAINS OF ZEP ZROBENT AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE. RESPONDER STARTED PROCESSING AFTER ARRIVING TO THE PSC CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2025021054
item.description:
Report X-2025021054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT BAY 371 WITH FULL PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET BASED ON THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL ON THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER READ CURRENT FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND USED ZEP ZORBENT TO CONTAIN THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT INTO A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER USED ZEP ZORBENT ON REMAINING SPILL RESIDUE ON THE GRATING AND THE FLOOR. RESPONDER THEN RETURNED TO THE PSC CAGE WITH THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER THEN STARTED PROCESSING.
